arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings: Three 8s after Ethan Laird downs Exeter - Alex Dicken
arts.sum: Laird scored the only goal of the game in first half stoppage time to ensure Blues stayed top of League One and extended their unbeaten run to 14 games across all competitions. Yokoyama killed a pass from Ben Davies with a superb first touch and jinked inside from the left before unleashing a shot that Whitworth was right behind.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City 1 Exeter City 0 - Grecians suffer narrow defeat to League One leaders - Devon Live
arts.sum: But the Grecians failed to have a single effort on goal themselves as they slipped to the 1-0 defeat, with Jack McMillan sent-off deep into the 17 minutes of stoppage-time which was played. An uneventful first half sprung to life in stoppage-time when with the first effort on goal, Birmingham took the lead.

arts.ttl: Ben Davies decision made as £40m man returns: Tottenham predicted XI v Everton
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur will once again look to get back to winning ways when they head to Everton in the Premier League on Sunday. Spurs fell...

arts.ttl: Chris Davies picks out Birmingham City player after ‘exceptional’ quality killed Exeter again
arts.sum: Chris Davies says Birmingham City’s pressing machine ‘smothered’ Exeter in the League One leaders’ latest victory. Davies credited Blues’ pressing power for that statistic.

arts.ttl: Exeter City face toughest test as they travel to Birmingham City
arts.sum: Last week’s excellent FA Cup win over Oxford United proved that, when on form, City can compete with teams higher than them in the ladder and they will have to be at their best to get anything today with Birmingham unbeaten at St Andrews in the league all season. “I don’t think many supporters will have been in that stadium, we haven’t played a league game against Birmingham for a long time, so it’s special for them to go there,” Caldwell said.

arts.ttl: Birmingham maintain League One lead with win at home to Exeter
Videos, a clear mantra and ‘a little bit of chaos’: Birmingham City through the eyes of Chris Davies
arts.sum: “I want to make sure that we’re not just making 10 yard passes all the time so it’s easy for the opposition, that we are looking to hurt them and attack their back-line – make runs in behind, cause chaos with crosses, counter-pressing. Blues have only scored five set piece goals in League One – only four teams have registered fewer – but their impressive defensive record provides balance to that statistic.

arts.ttl: Confirmed: Birmingham City complete first signing of January transfer window
arts.sum: During his time with the Canaries Hanley won two promotions to the Premier League and has spent the last six years as captain of the Carrow Road club. Hanley has featured in four games for Norwich this season and has only played 20 minutes of club football since August.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City set for triple boost but five players could miss Exeter match
arts.sum: Stansfield has missed Blues' last three matches due to a slight issue but manager Chris Davies confirmed the 22-year-old has returned to training pre-Exeter. Tomoki Iwata, Willum Willumsson, Keshi Anderson and Emil Hansson are all struggling with issues.

arts.ttl: Exeter City manager Gary Caldwell given two-match touchline ban
arts.sum: As Caldwell accepted the charge and no details were forthcoming when the commission sought details of Caldwell’s disciplinary record over the past five years, so he was hit with the standard penalty of a one match ban for abuse of the fourth official and £1,000 fine. Whilst not trying to justify his behaviour, Caldwell said his actions were the culmination of those decisions and while he faced two charges of misconduct – one to the fourth official and one to the referee – only a single change should be considered.
